1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)

2.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt

4.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

5.brief: narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
to butt with the horns; figuratively, to war against
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed

8.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)

9.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

10.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

11.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
an eatable (includ. provender, flesh and fruit)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to toss about; by implication, to diffuse, winnow

12.brief: to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

13.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a resident; by extension, a fellow-citizen
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around

14.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
a nodding or toss (of the head in derision)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

15.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

16.brief: to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish

17.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cheat, i.e. be untrue (usually in words)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

19.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)

20.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery

21.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

22.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
{properly, something slaughtered; hence, a beast (or meat, as butchered); abstractly butchery (or concretely, a place of slaughter)}

23.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)

24.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

26.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
